Capture is an innovative startup on a mission to streamline how we manage our thoughts, tasks, and information. Imagine a workspace where all your notes, to-dos, and files coexist effortlessly‚ÄîCapture offers just that. Founded in 2018, this New York City-based company emerged from Y Combinator‚Äôs Winter 2019 batch and has a small, dedicated team of four.

The essence of Capture can be summed up by their tagline: "All your notes, tasks, and files in one super-fast workspace." They started with the ambition to create an operating system for life, a place designed to help users tackle the overwhelming amount of information we encounter daily. Capture aims to provide a better way to manage this influx of data, making it easier to track what truly matters and plan around significant goals.

Currently, Capture is in private beta, gradually inviting users to explore its offerings. It allows users to quickly jot down notes, manage to-dos, save web pages, and much more, all while ensuring that no thought slips through the cracks.

Backed by the reputable Y Combinator, Capture is positioned in the productivity space‚Äîa hotbed for innovation and demand as people continuously seek to optimize their personal and professional lives. The company is steadily growing and refining its solution for those looking to declutter their digital lives.

For anyone interested in this fresh take on productivity, you can visit their website at [Capture.so](https://capture.so) and consider joining the beta. In a world overwhelmed with information, Capture is on the frontlines, ensuring that your most important thoughts never get lost.
